commit_message:
[Telemetry] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: I30f8dd2cbf0a6d81098dee44c32cdf76a2475901

[ironic] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: I650f4527ef01f0cb5d491dbd63e7f9d694aa3ad1

nova usage-list can return incorrect results, having resources counted
twice. This only occurs when using the 2.40 microversion or later.

This microversion introduced pagination, which doesn't work properly.
Nova API will sort the instances using the tenant id and instance uuid,
but 'os-simple-tenant-usage' will not preserve the order when returning
the results.

wrong marker (which is supposed to be the last instance id), ending
up counting the same instances twice.

Icd5e46e0276df6cf7ffbbb57abb1dddc46678e11 is not in Ocata.

commit_message:
Fix os-simple-tenant-usage result order

nova usage-list can return incorrect results, having resources counted
twice. This only occurs when using the 2.40 microversion or later.

This microversion introduced pagination, which doesn't work properly.
Nova API will sort the instances using the tenant id and instance uuid,
but 'os-simple-tenant-usage' will not preserve the order when returning
the results.

For this reason, subsequent API calls made by the client will use the
wrong marker (which is supposed to be the last instance id), ending
up counting the same instances twice.

 Conflicts:
	nova/api/openstack/compute/simple_tenant_usage.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflict is because change
Icd5e46e0276df6cf7ffbbb57abb1dddc46678e11 is not in Ocata.

Change-Id: I6c7a67b23ec49aa207c33c38580acd834bb27e3c
Closes-Bug: #1796689
(cherry picked from commit afc3a16ce3364c233e6e1cffc9f38987d1d65318)
(cherry picked from commit 133b194ba079abe84900d09a5c3c74ef9f464bab)
(cherry picked from commit 70b4cdce68f9b1543c032aa700e4f0f4289d90a6)
(cherry picked from commit 3a48ffa6e7aa76d27a62180d26cdd5cf7b749f8c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-12 14:27:36.000000000', 'message': 'Support qemu >= 2.10

Qemu 2.10 added the requirement of a --force-share flag to qemu-img
info when reading information about a disk that is in use by a
guest. We do this a lot in Nova for operations like gathering
information before live migration.

Up until this point all qemu/libvirt version matching has been solely
inside the libvirt driver, however all the image manip code was moved
out to nova.virt.images. We need the version of QEMU available there.

This does it by initializing that version on driver init host. The net
effect is also that broken libvirt connections are figured out
earlier, as there is an active probe for this value.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>

Change-Id: Iae2962bb86100f03fd3ad9aac3767da876291e74
Closes-Bug: #1718295
(cherry picked from commit 807579755c4a116309eca5b2bcdbab9d1f393bab)
Signed-off-by: George Melikov <mail@gmelikov.ru>
'}, {'created': '2020-04-08 09:47:25.000000000', 'message': 'Support qemu >= 2.10

Qemu 2.10 added the requirement of a --force-share flag to qemu-img
info when reading information about a disk that is in use by a
guest. We do this a lot in Nova for operations like gathering
information before live migration.

Up until this point all qemu/libvirt version matching has been solely
inside the libvirt driver, however all the image manip code was moved
out to nova.virt.images. We need the version of QEMU available there.

This does it by initializing that version on driver init host. The net
effect is also that broken libvirt connections are figured out
earlier, as there is an active probe for this value.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>

Change-Id: Iae2962bb86100f03fd3ad9aac3767da876291e74
Closes-Bug: #1718295
(cherry picked from commit 807579755c4a116309eca5b2bcdbab9d1f393bab)
Signed-off-by: George Melikov <mail@gmelikov.ru>
'}]
commit_message:
Support qemu >= 2.10

Qemu 2.10 added the requirement of a --force-share flag to qemu-img
info when reading information about a disk that is in use by a
guest. We do this a lot in Nova for operations like gathering
information before live migration.

Up until this point all qemu/libvirt version matching has been solely
inside the libvirt driver, however all the image manip code was moved
out to nova.virt.images. We need the version of QEMU available there.

This does it by initializing that version on driver init host. The net
effect is also that broken libvirt connections are figured out
earlier, as there is an active probe for this value.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>

Change-Id: Iae2962bb86100f03fd3ad9aac3767da876291e74
Closes-Bug: #1718295
(cherry picked from commit 807579755c4a116309eca5b2bcdbab9d1f393bab)
Signed-off-by: George Melikov <mail@gmelikov.ru>

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

[{'created': '2021-06-15 14:38:51.000000000', 'message': 'BnR Test NFS server conectivity & ubi-minimal container image

When ReaR is configure there is no validation on the NFS server,
this patch adds a simple ping test validation to the NFS server.
The NFS ping test can be disabled with a variable.

This patch also switches from centos-8 to ubi-minimal container.

Change-Id: Ibbf7ba3435da8dc9218403df76f0eb86df4374db
(cherry picked from commit 64932f1bcad982d1e85179149da9f3803b22ea8d)

'}]
commit_message:
BnR Test NFS server conectivity & ubi-minimal container image

When ReaR is configure there is no validation on the NFS server,
this patch adds a simple ping test validation to the NFS server.
The NFS ping test can be disabled with a variable.

This patch also switches from centos-8 to ubi-minimal container.

Change-Id: Ibbf7ba3435da8dc9218403df76f0eb86df4374db
(cherry picked from commit 64932f1bcad982d1e85179149da9f3803b22ea8d)
(cherry picked from commit 8bfee72c8c538d2c5f53cf07eef0e8dcf725901b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-09 19:33:51.000000000', 'message': "[watcher] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: I740b00fa8583a46d60d72bf9b8a1ea03105657e9
"}]
commit_message:
[watcher] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: I740b00fa8583a46d60d72bf9b8a1ea03105657e9

commit_message:
Fix inconsistent version in metadata.json

We released puppet-murano 15.5.0 recently but the version in
metadata.json was set to 15.4.1 accidentally. This bumps version
in metadata.json son that we can create a release with the consistent
version.

commit_message:
[OVN] Check for lock in check_for_mcast_flood_reports

The maintenance method check_for_mcast_flood_reports() was not checking
if that instance of the maintenance task has a valid lock before trying
to execute a transaction.

This patch adds such check so instances of the maintenance task without
a valid lock will just return.

(cherry picked from Neutron 317407fe61b76b8f0c250ce6fb18d93dd0b667d0)

Closes-Bug: #1927077
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ic84b2eacf0ec6ef36143a361e51a92c2f2723e8e

commit_message:
Skip scenario tests if HA router will not be active

Due to related bug, it may happen that HA router will not become active
on any of the L3 agents even in 10 minutes.
I know it's just ugly workaround, but to unblock our gate lets skip test
if that issue will happen, instead of failing whole job.
We know that issue and we are already working on fix for that.

Related-Bug: #1923633
Change-Id: I185a0d1031af9489731baa0f132762b61eb9c64f

'}, {'created': '2021-05-05 08:53:49.000000000', 'message': 'Reuse tripleo-ansible podman_container.py ansible module

Currently in content provider job, registry is deployed using
podman_container.py ansible module coming from tripleo-ansible.

tripleo-ansible is getting installed in TQ venv via TQE
requirements.txt file. We are removing that requirements.

And it will fail all the content provider.

During repo setup, tripleo-ansible is already installed via
RPM using tripleoclient.

During run-time, we need to that module, so we are copying
that module in TQ venv and run the container provider job
without failing it.

Closes-Bug: #1927171

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I977076549539893ef9f169c82aeb8b5db2725860

commit_message:
Deploy content provider registry using podman

Currently in content provider job, registry is deployed using
podman_container.py ansible module coming from tripleo-ansible.

tripleo-ansible is getting installed in TQ venv via TQE
requirements.txt file. We are removing that requirements.

And it will fail all the content provider.

During repo setup, tripleo-ansible is already installed via
RPM using tripleoclient.

During run-time, we need to podman_container.py ansible
module but on copying it is not getting loaded in the
ansible as we need to refresh the env.

So we are completely removing that and switching to
podman cli to handle that.

Closes-Bug: #1927171

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I977076549539893ef9f169c82aeb8b5db2725860

commit_message:
Container manage module

Use a module to manage podman containers rather than the async task
loops.  This change also includes fixes for container-puppet json data
to match the expectations of the module.

Change-Id: I214127ebeddbef2b85cc8deb3c108c8de907ee0a

[OVN] Re-enable dstat for the OVN jobs

dstat has been replaced with pcp-dstat in DevStack.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/791749
Change-Id: I680e534ecf7eb78e451a9a37959aab09b9091141
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Revert "Set system_scope='all' in elevated context"

This reverts commit 062336e59bb3d427bf4094779dc8e93d92c078d5.

Now, we have proper fix for the system_scope='all' in elevated context
in the neutron-lib so we can revert temporary fix made at the end of the
Wallaby cycle.

Related-Bug: #1920001

Conflicts:
    neutron/api/rpc/agentnotifiers/dhcp_rpc_agent_api.py
    neutron/common/utils.py
    neutron/db/address_group_db.py
    neutron/services/segments/db.py

Change-Id: Ife9b647b403bdd76a8a99984ea8858bf95c96bc3

commit_message:
Reproduce bug 1897528

The nova-compute fails to start if the hypervisor has PCI addresses
32bit domain.

Change-Id: I48dcb7faa17fe9f8346445a1746cff5845baf358
Related-Bug: #1897528
(cherry picked from commit 976ac722d36439d16ea4ec1bf5037c482c89ef55)
(cherry picked from commit 0354d4d9f47354e2b4fc0b2343c27e734fe2e494)

subject: volume: Allow more versions
messages:
[{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-05-25 11:32:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-05-26 09:45:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2021-05-26 15:13:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Thank you for your work on helping close the cinder/volume gaps!

I want to note that just because 3.x microversions are not rejected doesn't mean that OSC supports each microversion. I considered a patch similar to this one, but I got stuck worrying about the implication of suggesting OSC supports a specific cinder microversion when it really doesn't due to another gap that needs to be closed. For example, 3.47 adds the ability to create a volume by specifying a backup-id, but the volume create command needs to be enhanced to expose that capability.

I have a (long) set of notes on gaps like this."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-06-02 14:31:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-06-03 17:01:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2021-06-05 16:19:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2021-06-07 13:33:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I understand why Alan was stuck worrying about the implications, since I'm on the same spot.

I lean towards the idea that the clunky microversion support that we currently have is better than silently accepting microversions and ignoring them.  As far as I understand the user won't even get  new fields sent by Cinder for a specific microversion because we are being explicit about the columns to display.

I see there are a lot of patches adding microversion features in chained patches, so I won't downvote for this small difference in opinion.

Thank you for working on filling the OSC cinder gaps!!!"}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2021-06-07 16:13:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2021-06-16 16:39:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-06-17 09:17:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
volume: Allow more versions

Copy the API version checks from the 'openstackclient.compute.client'
module. These will only be necessary until we migrate everything to SDK
but it's very helpful until then.

Change-Id: I2d9c68db5bf891ffa25fd5a7fc9e8953e44b73ab
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Improve error log when snapshot fails

If snapshot creation via glance fails due to lack of space or over
quota, we want to have a clearer error message.

Change-Id: Ic9133f6bc14d4fe766d37a438bf52c33e89da768
Closes-Bug: #1613770
(cherry picked from commit 024bf10d8aec5e58111793a9652b16682eb61b7c)
(cherry picked from commit 9e9c022bde3a3ffdf0dd87e21bf9afde0dbc1e74)

subject: [tripleo] Transition Ocata to End of Life
messages:
[{'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-06-09 19:32:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-06-09 20:17:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-06-10 05:24:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-06-14 11:57:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-06-16 19:05:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I don't know what to do with this patch, as:
* there's no ocata-eol tag but
* there's no stable/ocata branch either
maybe we can just simply abandon this patch and we can ignore that ocata-eol tag does not exists on this repository..."}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-06-16 19:05:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-06-16 20:11:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

[{'created': '2021-06-09 19:32:45.000000000', 'message': "[tripleo] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: I19a14d8c4c571e098a1b03d00652de7774575123
"}]
commit_message:
[tripleo] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: I19a14d8c4c571e098a1b03d00652de7774575123

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-17 12:13:46.000000000', 'message': 'Set memcached server list from memcached_node_names

This follows other clustered services (like RabbitMQ) and
uses *_node_names (which contain FQDNs), instead of *_node_ips.

Certificate for Memcached TLS is also created using FQDN.
Because of this, validation failed when using pymemcache.
This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I674653d5cbf209c1743207a9f2019f53ac726d93
Closes-Bug: 1929574
'}]
commit_message:
Set memcached server list from memcached_node_names

This follows other clustered services (like RabbitMQ) and
uses *_node_names (which contain FQDNs), instead of *_node_ips.

Certificate for Memcached TLS is also created using FQDN.
Because of this, validation failed when using pymemcache.
This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I674653d5cbf209c1743207a9f2019f53ac726d93
Closes-Bug: 1929574

commit_message:
Drop Fedora support

Fedora support is never tested, and has been unmaintained for a while.
Because we don't expect any actual user using OpenStack on Fedora, this
change drops support for Fedora directly.

Change-Id: I98e31278591b3022c4ab2f635f7c830d9b4544e6

[{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-04-30 06:18:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-04-30 06:22:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-04-30 06:27:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-04-30 07:12:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

I think this patch will help Neutron administrators to sync both Nova (retrieved from libvirt if this backend is used) and Neutron hostname, without the need of defining "resource_provider_hypervisors" config var.

This patch needs a release note, in "features" section. A reference to [1] will be perfect to know the purpose of this patch.

Thanks!

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/696600/3/releasenotes/notes/locate-rp-tree-parent-by-hypervisor-name-3244ed87dc57f950.yaml'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-04-30 07:45:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-04-30 07:46:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-04-30 07:50:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)

Hi Radolfo,

Thank you for your early feedback !

> I think this patch will help Neutron administrators to sync both Nova (retrieved from libvirt if this backend is used) and Neutron hostname, without the need of defining "resource_provider_hypervisors" config var.
Yes. That is my motivation to implement this patch! :-)

 
> This patch needs a release note, in "features" section. A reference to [1] will be perfect to know the purpose of this patch.

I added a release note with a reference to the change.

I think this can be regarded as bug fix rather than feature implementation because it has been our expectation that neutron detects the correct hypervisor name since that implementation was merged.
I believe this is a backport candidate so that's another reason I hesitate to mark this as a feature implementation.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2021-04-30 09:23:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Doesn't we fixed this already with https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1853840"}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-05-06 10:47:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

fyi, we also had a chat with Sean on #openstack-nova http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/%23openstack-nova.2021-05-06.log.html#t2021-05-06T10:08:06'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-05-14 12:16:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Patch Set 5:
> 
> Doesn't we fixed this already with https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1853840

The fix for the bug didn't fix this problem as long as we use default.
 https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/696600/

That change made neutron use socket.gethostname() to determine the default resource provider name.
On the other hand nova uses libvirt hostname as resource provider name, and this is a canonical name which doesn't always agree with socket.gethostname()

The above change introduced the resource_provider_hypivisors parameter to override the hypervisor name and this allows use to fix that inconsistency.
However IMO this solution is not very user-friendly, because users should list all devices/interfaces to override a single default hypervisor name."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-05-14 13:13:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Patch Set 5:
> 
> > Patch Set 5:
> > 
> > Doesn't we fixed this already with https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1853840
> 
> The fix for the bug didn't fix this problem as long as we use default.
>  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/696600/
> 
> That change made neutron use socket.gethostname() to determine the default resource provider name.
> On the other hand nova uses libvirt hostname as resource provider name, and this is a canonical name which doesn't always agree with socket.gethostname()
> 
> The above change introduced the resource_provider_hypivisors parameter to override the hypervisor name and this allows use to fix that inconsistency.
> However IMO this solution is not very user-friendly, because users should list all devices/interfaces to override a single default hypervisor name.

well the default work as long as we do not set the FQDN as the canonical hostname in
/etc/hosts which is why we do not see this issue in devstack jobs or with non ooo deployments

i agree that the current config options are not really that friendly."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-05-14 13:20:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

i see 4 paths forward.

1.) we proceed with this change with the knolage this may break people that rely on the current behavior
or use the hostname not the FQDN as canonical hostname in /etc/hosts.

2.) we restore your other patch  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/763563 and have ooo set that value.

3.) we make nutron lookup the root rp using the hostname and if it does not find it look it up with the fqdn.

4.) have neutron use the hyperviors api to lookup the uuid of the root rp that way. the hypervior list could be cached on inital start of the neutron server and updated only if a host is not found in the cache to minimse the over head.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-05-14 13:22:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> Patch Set 5:
> 
> i see 4 paths forward.
> 
> 1.) we proceed with this change with the knolage this may break people that rely on the current behavior
> or use the hostname not the FQDN as canonical hostname in /etc/hosts.
> 
> 2.) we restore your other patch  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/763563 and have ooo set that value.
> 
> 3.) we make nutron lookup the root rp using the hostname and if it does not find it look it up with the fqdn.
> 
> 4.) have neutron use the hyperviors api to lookup the uuid of the root rp that way. the hypervior list could be cached on inital start of the neutron server and updated only if a host is not found in the cache to minimse the over head.

i ment to say im leaning towords option 2 or 3 personally since they means neutron can remain hyperviors agnostic .'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-05-14 13:40:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Patch Set 5:
> 
> i see 4 paths forward.
> 
> 1.) we proceed with this change with the knolage this may break people that rely on the current behavior
> or use the hostname not the FQDN as canonical hostname in /etc/hosts.

This change doesn't break existing deployment with libvirt driver. If the canonical hostname is a short name then the new logic returns the same result (a shot name).

On the other hand I agree that this would break existing deployment with virt type which doesn't use canonical hostname as hypervisor (resource provider) name.

So the question would be whether we prefer to fix compatibility with libvirt or keep the current behavior for the other virt drivers.

> ...
> 
> 4.) have neutron use the hyperviors api to lookup the uuid of the root rp that way. the hypervior list could be cached on inital start of the neutron server and updated only if a host is not found in the cache to minimse the over head.

I'm just curious but what can we use as a key to look up the uuid ? If we use any hostname then I guess we should solve the same issue because the hypervisor name is a canonical name when libvirt driver is used, if I understand correctly."}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-05-14 13:43:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Patch Set 5:
> 
> ...
> 
> i ment to say im leaning towords option 2 or 3 personally since they means neutron can remain hyperviors agnostic .

I'd prefer 2 than 3 considering automatic fallback might result in unexpected situation in very specific cases.
Also, even if we decide to take path 1, we should implement 2 at the same time because some virt drivers would always require a short name and any option to refer the behavior change."}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-05-24 23:38:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I've restored https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/763563 which introduces the parameter to override the default hypvervisor. This would provide a better workaround about this issue.

Assuming that libvirt is the most popular option, I think this change is still valuable because users can rely on automatic hypervisor detection as long as they use libvirt driver.
One concern is that this doesn't break any deployment with libvirt but might break ones with other virt driver. However users can fix the issue using the parameter introduced by the above change."}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-06-14 06:58:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

We should merge this patch in combination with [1]. If the default virt driver is libvirt, that will provide out of the box compatibility between Nova a Neutron naming. That will make unnecessary the use of "resource_provider_default_hypervisor" and "resource_provider_hypervisors" in most of the deployments.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/763563'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-06-14 23:55:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-06-15 00:33:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-06-15 00:39:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2021-06-15 02:34:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Build succeeded.

recheck'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2021-06-15 08:56:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

commit_message:
Make default hypervisor hostname compatible with libvirt

This change ensures that neutron relies on the same logic as libvirt
to generate hypervisor hostname, to fix imcompatible hostname format
used in Nova and Neutron for resource provider name in some
configuration pattens like the one generated by TripleO.

Closes-Bug: #1926693
Change-Id: Iea2533f4c52935b4ecda9ec22fb619c131febfa1

commit_message:
docs: improve automated seed development info

* add 'bridge_type: linuxbridge' to tenks configuration to avoid
  dependency on OVS
* extend seed development environment testing to include overcloud
  provisioning and deployment
* remove seed hypervisor and seed VM environments. These are very
  stale, and largely replaced by a-universe-from-nothing. Add a link to
  that workshop on the same page

Change-Id: I9928e5912e6770bdcc1d5d0884d2f101c16ee6a9
(cherry picked from commit d2e3f6f1aec2c1ed301144ed26872394799346fb)

commit_message:
docs: add variable for current branch

This allows us to include the correct branch when cloning repositories
in documentation.

Method adapted from OpenStack Ansible documentation. A backslash is
added on purpose before repository URLs to bypass highlighting which
makes them less readable (dark text on dark background).

https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/src/branch/master/doc/source/conf.py

[CI] Support building source images with in-review changes

The Kolla-Ansible part.

instead of generating config locally.

commit_message:
Sync pkgs from host to container in standalone upgrade

In order to get latest packages in the containers matching from
the host to avoid unwanted failures, we are introducing
container-check script to update the containers.

By toggling sync_container_pkgs to true, it will update
the packages version from host to containers.

Related-Bug: #1907769

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I762848c287ee97258ea1ba0de80454202d8a59ab

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-05 02:24:58.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I13b4370daac5ef33f5422ef996c88a85730e3628
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I13b4370daac5ef33f5422ef996c88a85730e3628

commit_message:
Changing group show commmand into a lister.

The CLI group info command now uses preset path
to the validation groups file if no other is supplied.

The default value is set in both CLI and the 'group_information'
method of the ValidationActions class.

Tests adjusted.

Resolves: rhbz#1972155

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iff12dff9a870e3e3b89e8070bc251401498ea623

Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-22 14:31:56.000000000', 'message': 'Remove allocations before setting vm_status to SHELVED_OFFLOADED

Tempest is intermittently failing a test which does the
following:

1. Create a server.
2. Shelve offload it.
3. Unshelve it.

Tempest waits for the server status to be SHELVED_OFFLOADED
before unshelving the server, which goes through the
scheduler to pick a compute node and claim resources on it.

When shelve offloading a server, the resource allocations
for the instance and compute node it was on are cleared, which
will also delete the internal consumer record in the placement
service.

The race is that the allocations are removed during shelve
offload *after* the server status changes to SHELVED_OFFLOADED.
This leaves a window where unshelve is going through the
scheduler and gets the existing allocations for the instance,
which are non-empty and have a consumer generation. The
claim_resources method in the scheduler then uses that
consumer generation when PUTing the allocations. That PUT
fails because in between the GET and PUT of the allocations,
placement has deleted the internal consumer record. When
PUTing the new allocations with a non-null consumer generation,
placement returns a 409 conflict error because for a new
consumer it expects the "consumer_generation" parameter to be
None.

This change handles the race by simply making sure the allocations
are deleted (along with the related consumer record in placement)
*before* the instance.vm_status is changed.

Change-Id: I2a6ccaff904c1f0759d55feeeef0ec1da32c65df
Closes-Bug: #1798688
(cherry picked from commit 6369f39244558b147f7b0796269d9a86ce9b12d8)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove allocations before setting vm_status to SHELVED_OFFLOADED

Tempest is intermittently failing a test which does the
following:

1. Create a server.
2. Shelve offload it.
3. Unshelve it.

Tempest waits for the server status to be SHELVED_OFFLOADED
before unshelving the server, which goes through the
scheduler to pick a compute node and claim resources on it.

When shelve offloading a server, the resource allocations
for the instance and compute node it was on are cleared, which
will also delete the internal consumer record in the placement
service.

The race is that the allocations are removed during shelve
offload *after* the server status changes to SHELVED_OFFLOADED.
This leaves a window where unshelve is going through the
scheduler and gets the existing allocations for the instance,
which are non-empty and have a consumer generation. The
claim_resources method in the scheduler then uses that
consumer generation when PUTing the allocations. That PUT
fails because in between the GET and PUT of the allocations,
placement has deleted the internal consumer record. When
PUTing the new allocations with a non-null consumer generation,
placement returns a 409 conflict error because for a new
consumer it expects the "consumer_generation" parameter to be
None.

This change handles the race by simply making sure the allocations
are deleted (along with the related consumer record in placement)
*before* the instance.vm_status is changed.

Change-Id: I2a6ccaff904c1f0759d55feeeef0ec1da32c65df
Closes-Bug: #1798688
(cherry picked from commit 6369f39244558b147f7b0796269d9a86ce9b12d8)

commit_message:
Modify the meeting channel preference

As discussed during the migration from IRC freenode to
OFTC[1], TC encourage project team to hold their meeting
on their project channel.

Updating project team guide to reflect that.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-May/022718.html

Change-Id: I6c58ff14402238b067a093e6d3974cbb5faf3b1b

commit_message:
Previously generated API docs clean up.

The API	documentation generated	by the sphix-apidoc
is now automatically removed before new	sphinx run.

This is	a QoL improvement on local machines, where removal
of a documented	module, and continued existence of associated doc,
can cause unnecessary errors.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I114f0318a8d5ffff0cf2c923721a090cd0a4cee7

commit_message:
Previously generated API docs clean up.

The API documentation generated by the sphix-apidoc
is now automatically removed before new sphinx run.

This is a QoL improvement on local machines, where removal
of a documented module, and continued existence of associated doc,
can cause unnecessary errors.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I27ae32306206ba4f0a9eeb25ccf9d3c619ca5afa

messages:
[{'account_id': 33105, 'date': '2021-02-17 19:11:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 33105, 'date': '2021-02-17 19:13:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Mark, here is the second potential fix we spoke about inside the bug-id 1915528.
Thank you for all your help!'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-02-18 09:24:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Thanks. Chrony looks happy on CentOS also.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-06-17 07:22:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-17 19:11:54.000000000', 'message': 'chronyd crash loop if Debian server is rebooted

This patch fixes the constant chrony container crash loop after (Debian 10) server is rebooted,
as described in Bug-ID: #1915528.

Due to permissions issue, before this fix is applied chronyd process will be exiting with
root cause error message:

Fatal error : Could not open configuration file /etc/chrony/chrony.conf : Permission denied
This has to do with priviledges we configured for chrony. Relaxing them fixes the issue.
Tested on top of stable/victoria and Debian 10 Buster.

Not tested on CentOS/RHEL. If this does not work well on RHEL/CentOS we can maybe parametrise
the owner and make it configurable (just one idea).

Closes-Bug: #1915528
Change-Id: I71f45ba5b9d1d2227c95633d3de51e2ccd42a467
'}]
commit_message:
chronyd crash loop if Debian server is rebooted

This patch fixes the constant chrony container crash loop after (Debian 10) server is rebooted,
as described in Bug-ID: #1915528.

Due to permissions issue, before this fix is applied chronyd process will be exiting with
root cause error message:

Fatal error : Could not open configuration file /etc/chrony/chrony.conf : Permission denied
This has to do with priviledges we configured for chrony. Relaxing them fixes the issue.
Tested on top of stable/victoria and Debian 10 Buster.

Not tested on CentOS/RHEL. If this does not work well on RHEL/CentOS we can maybe parametrise
the owner and make it configurable (just one idea).

Closes-Bug: #1915528
Change-Id: I71f45ba5b9d1d2227c95633d3de51e2ccd42a467

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-07 22:45:04.000000000', 'message': 'Support editable installation in all cases

An editable installation allows changes to be made to the source code
directly, and have those changes applied immediately without having to
reinstall.

    pip install -e /path/to/kolla-ansible

Above is currently working only in virtualenv, but there is no reason to
not allow in all cases. This is usefull for example when user is
building his own docker container with editable kolla-ansible installed
from git without virtualenv.

Change-Id: I185f7c09c3f026fd6926a26001393f066ff1860d
'}, {'created': '2021-04-08 11:15:27.000000000', 'message': 'Support editable installation in all cases

An editable installation allows changes to be made to the source code
directly, and have those changes applied immediately without having to
reinstall.

    pip install -e /path/to/kolla-ansible

Above is currently working only in virtualenv, but there is no reason to
not allow in all cases. This is usefull for example when user is
building his own docker container with editable kolla-ansible installed

commit_message:
Support editable installation in all cases

An editable installation allows changes to be made to the source code
directly, and have those changes applied immediately without having to
reinstall.

    pip install -e /path/to/kolla-ansible

Above is currently working only in virtualenv, but there is no reason to
not allow in all cases. This is usefull for example when user is
building his own docker container with editable kolla-ansible installed
from git without virtualenv.

Change-Id: I185f7c09c3f026fd6926a26001393f066ff1860d

[{'created': '2021-05-17 15:36:49.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore PCI devices with 32bit domain

Nova and QEMU[1] supports PCI devices with a PCI address that has 16 bit
domain. However there are hypervisors that reports PCI addresses with
32 bit domain. While today we cannot assign these to guests this should
not prevent the nova-compute service to start.

This patch changes the PCI manager to ignore such PCI devices.

Please note that this patch does not change fact that nova does not
allow specifying PCI addresses with 32bit domain in the
[pci]/passthrough_whitelist configuration. Such configuration is still
rejected at nova-compute service startup.

Closes-Bug: #1897528

[1] https://github.com/qemu/qemu/blob/f2a1cf9180f63e88bb38ff21c169da97c3f2bad5/hw/core/qdev-properties.c#L993

Change-Id: I59a0746b864610b6a314078cf5661d3d2b84b1d4
(cherry picked from commit 8c9d6fc8f073cde78b79ae259c9915216f5d59b0)
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore PCI devices with 32bit domain

Nova and QEMU[1] supports PCI devices with a PCI address that has 16 bit
domain. However there are hypervisors that reports PCI addresses with
32 bit domain. While today we cannot assign these to guests this should
not prevent the nova-compute service to start.

This patch changes the PCI manager to ignore such PCI devices.

Please note that this patch does not change fact that nova does not
allow specifying PCI addresses with 32bit domain in the
[pci]/passthrough_whitelist configuration. Such configuration is still
rejected at nova-compute service startup.

Closes-Bug: #1897528

[1] https://github.com/qemu/qemu/blob/f2a1cf9180f63e88bb38ff21c169da97c3f2bad5/hw/core/qdev-properties.c#L993

Change-Id: I59a0746b864610b6a314078cf5661d3d2b84b1d4
(cherry picked from commit 8c9d6fc8f073cde78b79ae259c9915216f5d59b0)

subject: baremetal: fix /etc/hosts generation when api_interface has dashes
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-04 16:11:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2021-06-07 02:20:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-06-17 07:08:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-04 16:11:23.000000000', 'message': 'baremetal: fix /etc/hosts generation when api_interface has dashes

Interface names with dashes can cause problems in Ansible since dashes
are replaced with underscores when referencing facts. In the baremetal
role we reference the fact for api_interface without replacing dashes
with underscores. This may result in host entries being omitted from
/etc/hosts.

This change fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I667adc7d8a7dbd20dbfa293f389e02355f8275bb
Related-Bug: #1927357
'}]
commit_message:
baremetal: fix /etc/hosts generation when api_interface has dashes

Interface names with dashes can cause problems in Ansible since dashes
are replaced with underscores when referencing facts. In the baremetal
role we reference the fact for api_interface without replacing dashes
with underscores. This may result in host entries being omitted from
/etc/hosts.

This change fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I667adc7d8a7dbd20dbfa293f389e02355f8275bb
Related-Bug: #1927357

commit_message:
Horizon: Install required policy files for heat-dashboard

Since the commit 8e7914fce24d2c9d94a83795983aaa0fb05f020c was merged,
heat-dashboard no longer use policy.json but it use two yaml files to
manage policy rules. This change updates managed files for
heat-dashboard accordingly.

Change-Id: I0cae18c1d5169cd444a14ba3b56de24dede5919c

commit_message:
Increased strictness of the doc build

Warnings are now turned into errors, failing
the doc build. This should prevent any more
syntax issues resulting in malformed, but still syntactically
valid, html output.

To aid with diagnosis of the failures:

The -E flag is now set to rebuild environment
from scratch for each run.

The `-a` flag is set to rebuild all html files,
regardless of their date.

The `--keep-going` flag is set so that the build
doesn't end after encountering first error, but
continues until the bitter end.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I591ca3686f72ed6c0426cf272adb8c95330509b5

commit_message:
Horizon: Install policy files for manila-ui

Since the commit 89a90ff9773b93062760df5e3deefb9750112633 was merged,
manila-ui provides two policy files. This change ensures that these
files are installed when manila-ui is enabled.

Change-Id: Id92145ba74237da2fd8430b9d84413465297d3a7

commit_message:
horizon: Correct location of monitoring_policy file

Patch to correctly copy monitoring_policy.json into
/etc/openstack-dashboard.  Policy was misplaced, and not being enforced.

Note that by current default policy, admin doesn't not have Monitoring
access.

Closes-Bug: #1928408
Change-Id: I4faabdfa9c273fc61b536e6ce88b8d71ab2fc581

commit_message:
Test SRIOV port move operations with PCI conflicts

This patch tests cold migration, unshelve and evacuate in a situation
where the existing port binding's pci_slot would cause a conflict on
the destination compute node. While cold migration and evacuation
work correctly, in the unshelve case the pci_slot is not updated,
resulting in two instances attempting to consume the same PCI device.
This "passed" in the functional tests, but with a real libvirt this
would obviously explode.

Related: bug 1851545

Change-Id: Ib81532dc1e6dd85822e38eb1785ffb7162d2a84d
(cherry picked from commit bea06123dbba82851fd17a41cc93ab4a519f8bfe)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-19 18:17:36.000000000', 'message': "Neutron fixture: don't clobber profile and vif_details if empty

Previously, the way Neutron fixture's update_port method was coded
would cause the binding:profile and binding:vid_details fields to get
clobbered if they were not passed to the update. This was because if
nothing was passed, a default of {} was used. This is not how the real
Neutron API behaves. If nothing is passed, the previous values remain
and are not replaced with {}. This patches fixes this in the Neutron
fixture.

Change-Id: Ia7ad1322b5a15d1407140c77fe0edb179f66ec7a
(cherry picked from commit 62868aaac70d908ade6ff80c8ced54afa0435a76)
"}]
commit_message:
Neutron fixture: don't clobber profile and vif_details if empty

Previously, the way Neutron fixture's update_port method was coded
would cause the binding:profile and binding:vid_details fields to get
clobbered if they were not passed to the update. This was because if
nothing was passed, a default of {} was used. This is not how the real
Neutron API behaves. If nothing is passed, the previous values remain
and are not replaced with {}. This patches fixes this in the Neutron
fixture.

Change-Id: Ia7ad1322b5a15d1407140c77fe0edb179f66ec7a
(cherry picked from commit 62868aaac70d908ade6ff80c8ced54afa0435a76)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-24 04:08:42.000000000', 'message': "libvirt:driver:Disallow AIO=native when 'O_DIRECT' is not available

Because of the libvirt issue[1], there is a bug[2] that if we set cache mode
whose write semantic is not O_DIRECT (.i.e unsafe, writeback or writethrough),
there will be a problem with the volume drivers
(.i.e nova.virt.libvirt.volume.LibvirtISCSIVolumeDriver,
nova.virt.libvirt.volume.LibvirtNFSVolumeDriver and so on), which designate
native io explicitly.

That problem will generate a libvirt xml for the instance,
whose content contains

```
...
<disk ... >
  <driver ... cache='unsafe/writeback/writethrough' io='native' />
</disk>
...
```
In turn, it will fail to start the instance or attach the disk.

> When qemu is configured with a block device that has aio=native set, but
> the cache mode doesn't use O_DIRECT (i.e. isn't cache=none/directsync or any
> unnamed mode with explicit cache.direct=on), then the raw-posix block driver
> for local files and block devices will silently fall back to aio=threads.
> The blockdev-add interface rejects such combinations, but qemu can't
> change the existing legacy interfaces that libvirt uses today.

[1]: https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/commit/058384003db776c580d0e5a3016a6384e8eb7b92
[2]: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1086704

Closes-Bug: #1841363
Change-Id: If9acc054100a6733f3659a15dd9fc2d462e84d64

commit_message:
libvirt:driver:Disallow AIO=native when 'O_DIRECT' is not available

Because of the libvirt issue[1], there is a bug[2] that if we set cache mode
whose write semantic is not O_DIRECT (.i.e unsafe, writeback or writethrough),
there will be a problem with the volume drivers
(.i.e nova.virt.libvirt.volume.LibvirtISCSIVolumeDriver,
nova.virt.libvirt.volume.LibvirtNFSVolumeDriver and so on), which designate
native io explicitly.

That problem will generate a libvirt xml for the instance,
whose content contains

```
...
<disk ... >
  <driver ... cache='unsafe/writeback/writethrough' io='native' />
</disk>
...
```
In turn, it will fail to start the instance or attach the disk.

> When qemu is configured with a block device that has aio=native set, but
> the cache mode doesn't use O_DIRECT (i.e. isn't cache=none/directsync or any
> unnamed mode with explicit cache.direct=on), then the raw-posix block driver
> for local files and block devices will silently fall back to aio=threads.
> The blockdev-add interface rejects such combinations, but qemu can't
> change the existing legacy interfaces that libvirt uses today.

[1]: https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/commit/058384003db776c580d0e5a3016a6384e8eb7b92
[2]: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1086704

Closes-Bug: #1841363
Change-Id: If9acc054100a6733f3659a15dd9fc2d462e84d64
(cherry picked from commit af2405e1181d70cdf60bcd0e40b3e80f2db2e3a6)
(cherry picked from commit 0bd58921a1fcaffcc4fac25f63434c9cab93b061)
(cherry picked from commit d92fe4f3e69db51b7bbad52a1fe1740e37bade9a)
(cherry picked from commit cc2f45ebb03326c757abbfaef4de3e2c1fa4ead2)

commit_message:
Fix functional jobs due to OVS file removal

The neutron file devstack/lib/ovs was removed in
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/793470
in favor of using the devstack in-tree version at
lib/neutron_plugins/ovs_source.  Start using it to
un-break the functional jobs.

Change-Id: I0b847bd24305204388f1ff9dcb83fb6e11d2bac0

[{'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2017-11-02 18:11:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2017-11-06 03:01:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)

Did a quick/light review. I like the way this is going. I'd love to see a package swift.common.tasks that contains the generic methods (eg: get_task_container, ...). Few thoughts below."}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2017-12-20 12:50:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2017-12-20 20:46:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2017-12-20 20:47:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2017-12-21 11:29:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2017-12-21 11:30:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Updated docs.
I will add tests next.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2017-12-22 03:33:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Great work on this Kazuhiro! It looks really cool. I have left some comments inline.

So to solve the legacy problem, you can turn on the boolean value. Is it expected then that only 1 of you object servers will then deal with legacy expiration? What if its a big cluster that used to use the processes and process (running multiple expirers) with heaps of objects still yet to be expired in the future?

In that case do we need to have the legecy boolean and in that case still also support the process and processes so they can still work as it used too.. only all new expiring objects will use the new task queue?'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2017-12-22 07:26:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2017-12-22 07:28:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

(3 comments)

Matthew, thank you for your comments!

About legacy problem:
Q: Is it expected then that only 1 of you object servers will then deal with legacy expiration?
A: Yes.

Q: What if its a big cluster that used to use the processes and process (running multiple expirers) with heaps of objects still yet to be expired in the future?
A: I think nothing bad will happens.
   In my understanding, processes and process are required to gain throughput of task execution. Because if task execution throughput is less than task registration throughput, expired-but-not-yet-deleted objects will continue increasing.
   But in general task queue feature, task registration throughput for legacy task queue is ZERO. So I think only 1 object-expirer for legacy task queue is enough.
   Of course, legacy task execution will delay as compared to multi-process execution. But it will completed eventually.

How do you think?'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-01-10 11:15:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-01-10 11:46:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Added unit tests.
I think no update of functional tests are needed, because this patch doesn't change expirer's frontend behaviors.

Now, all unit tests and all functional tests succeed in my environment.

I will update probe tests in this week."}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-01-10 20:48:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-01-10 20:53:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1

Sorry, I forgot to check some of unit tests.
I need to fix the unit tests too.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-01-11 04:30:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

This is looking really cool Kazuhiro. Just some inline comments and a few fixes. I still need to look at the tests.'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-01-15 09:14:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-01-15 09:16:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

(5 comments)

Updated unit tests and reflect Matthew's comments.

I need to update probe tests next..."}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-01-15 23:24:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Awesome nice work Kazuhiro.

We need to add some documentation back about the legecy process and processes. If you want I can push a follow up patch you can merge in if it makes your life easer.

Next I want to run in in my SAIO and test it as much as I can.'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-01-16 09:35:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-01-16 09:41:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Didn't reflect Matthew's review comments yet."}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-01-17 10:00:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-01-17 10:04:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Fix merge conflict'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2018-01-18 09:11:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

(10 comments)

just a quick look through the patch set.

I think we should think about the upgrade impact from legacy config to the new config even we added legacy mode here. what i'm worried about is the object-expier.conf is being a section in the object-sever.conf. For newbees, it would be no problem and it's reasonable because the general task queue needs object-srever ip ports. However, for existing clusters, it would be careful problem on the order of steps to upgrade. I worry a bit about the upgrade impact revealed by the failing probe test ... are we going to need to inline an internal-client.conf similar to what we did for container-sync? See https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/2.17.0/swift/container/sync.py#L47-L97

I suppose having a busted expirer during the upgrade isn't the worst thing... we still 404 just fine, we just won't clean up until we can get a fresh config out..."}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-03-26 10:22:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

> are we going to need to inline an internal-client.conf similar to what we did for container-sync?

I don't think so. The reason why container-sync needs inline internal-client.conf is that container-sync have used direct-client before. So inline conf is required to get backward compatibility.

In this patch, object-expirer can work with "object-expirer.conf" in legacy-queue mode without any change of the conf file. So I think this change has backward compatibility.

The probe test failures come from difference between configure file style of legacy-queue mode and general-queue mode. In my opinion, we should think general-queue mode object-expirer as a kind of new daemon. So there are no backward compatibility for general-queue mode and this is intentional.

Anyway, I need to fix probe tests...'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-03-27 08:45:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-03-28 06:27:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

Changes in patch set 29 are following:
1. Added `enqueue_expirirng_objects_to_legacy_queue` option to proxy-server and object-server. So, expirer tasks' destination queue is configurable now.
2. Restored the removed legacy task probe tests. So, there are both of legacy task probe tests and general task probe tests.
3. Renamed `execute_legacuy_task` option to `dequeue_from_legacy_queue`.
4. Now, default value of `dequeue_from_legacy_queue` is true. This default value is not depends on file name ('object-expirer.conf' or 'object-server.conf'). Because it is more simple.
5. Now, object-expirer general task queue mode works with `servers_per_port` option.

These changes are depends on discussion with kota.

Now, I'm splitting this patch. So this patch is NOT ready for review."}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-09-12 06:27:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 30.'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-09-12 08:36:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 31.'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-09-12 08:38:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/601950/'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-09-12 16:15:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32: Patch Set 31 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2018-09-12 19:48:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32:

(1 comment)

small comment.'}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2018-09-13 16:38:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Issue:
The object-expirer can run in only one mode: legacy or generic. On a cluster where object-expirer are deployed on object-servers, an object-expirer would not be consuming generic queue if it is designed to be a legacy queue consumer.

Solution (as discussed at the PTG Denver 2018):
The object-expirer must be able to run in one of the 3 following mode:
- legacy
- generic
- legacy and generic

The condition to choose the mode is:
- on non object-servers, run in legacy mode, get configuration from object-expirer.conf
- on object-server:
  - if there is only object-expirer.conf, run in legacy mode
  - if there is a section [object-expirer] in object-server.conf, run in legacy+generic mode

The upgrade process for operators will be:
1/ Upgrade cluster
   => expirer tasks are created in legacy queue
   => object-expirer consume tasks from the legacy queue

2/ Deploy object-expirer on all object-servers (with config):
   => expirer tasks are created in legacy queue
   => object-expirer consume tasks from legacy and generic queues

3/ Update proxy/object config to create tasks in generic queue
   => expirer tasks are created in generic queue
   => object-expirer consume tasks from legacy and generic queues

To determine if the server is an object-server:
 - look for an object ring
 - check that myips are in one of the object rings'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2018-09-13 18:10:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32:

(32 comments)

Ok, I think i've got this all loaded into my head...

This is my biggest problem:

THIS CHANGE:

	vagrant@saio:~$ time nosetests swift/test/probe/test_object_expirer.py 
	..........
	----------------------------------------------------------------------
	Ran 10 tests in 1829.204s

	OK

	real	30m30.007s
	user	9m55.756s
	sys	5m34.880s

MASTER:

	vagrant@saio:~$ time nosetests swift/test/probe/test_object_expirer.py 
	.....
	----------------------------------------------------------------------
	Ran 5 tests in 161.084s

	OK

	real	2m41.843s
	user	0m50.648s
	sys	1m2.408s

and I think it relates to my trepidation about the task queue naming, which I still need to think about."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-05-03 22:58:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 43: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Recap of discussion at PTG:

There dequeue_from_legacy_task_queue option should be *additive* we  need three modes

1) you can run ONLY from legacy using object-expirer.conf
2) you will BY DEFAULT run ONLY from general-task-q using [object-expirer] in object-server.conf
3) you MAY enable running from BOTH legacy and general-task-q using dequeue_from_legacy OR processes/process in the [object-expirer] in object-server.conf

With a modest part power and a couple of rings there's a lot of requests to list the general task queue, many of them 404 on a sparse development environment.  This can be mitigated by reducing part_power to 6, or changing the module index so that ONLY the replica_index == 0 node lists the container, and does ALL the rows... however a different queue layout would be more efficient for some operations:

the general task queue should look like:

.task-<ring>-<type>/<partition>

An instance of the expirer might just list it's container partition, but if it gets a few 404s, it could with a small random sleep list it's account and "skip ahead"

Also this layout would have more reasonable cardinality in the containers, with probably between 10-100K objects per container instead of only 1

There's a few other things/comments that would be nice to cleanup, but these are the larger changes that should be addressed first.'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2019-05-04 10:38:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 44.'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2019-05-04 10:44:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 44:

(10 comments)

Update for some clay's comments.
This update doesn't include "task queue three modes" and ".task-<ring>-<type>/<partition> style queue".'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2019-05-04 14:00:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 45: Published edit on patch set 44.'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2019-05-04 14:51:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 46: Published edit on patch set 45.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-06-17 04:18:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 47.'}]

At first step for general task queue system [1], this patch updates
object-expirer's task system to use the general task queue. With
this change, object-expirer's task queue will gain scalabilily. a
large number of object-expirers will be able to run on a large swift
cluster at the same time.

The general task queue system will be used in auto tiering task
system too.

[1] Basic idea: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Swift/ideas/task-execution
[2] Details: https://docs.google.com/document/d/11sBbB6pBvLYNeM9wjTdvvsJIu8Dl8i13UH2NfRVNOqg/edit#

"}, {'created': '2018-02-09 08:51:50.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add object-expirer new mode to execute tasks from general task queue

At first step for general task queue system [1], this patch adds
object-expirer's task system to use the general task queue. With
this change, object-expirer's task queue will gain scalabilily. a
large number of object-expirers will be able to run on a large swift
cluster at the same time.

The general task queue system will be used in auto tiering task
system too.

[1] Basic idea: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Swift/ideas/task-execution
[2] Details: https://docs.google.com/document/d/11sBbB6pBvLYNeM9wjTdvvsJIu8Dl8i13UH2NfRVNOqg/edit#

Co-Authored-By: Matthew Oliver <matt@oliver.net.au>

"}, {'created': '2018-02-27 09:36:45.000000000', 'message': "Add object-expirer new mode to execute tasks from general task queue

At first step for general task queue system [1], this patch adds
object-expirer's task system to use the general task queue. With
this change, object-expirer's task queue will gain scalabilily. a
large number of object-expirers will be able to run on a large swift
cluster at the same time.

After this patch, enqueue target of expiring tssks are automatically changed to
general task queue. Dequeue target of expiring tasks can be choosen by operator
from legacy (=the task queue used before this patch) or general task queue.

The general task queue system will be used in auto tiering task system too.

[1] Basic idea: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Swift/ideas/task-execution
[2] Details: https://docs.google.com/document/d/11sBbB6pBvLYNeM9wjTdvvsJIu8Dl8i13UH2NfRVNOqg/edit#

commit_message:
Add object-expirer new mode to execute tasks from general task queue

At first step for general task queue system [1], this patch adds
object-expirer's task system to use the general task queue. With
this change, object-expirer's task queue will gain scalabilily. a
large number of object-expirers will be able to run on a large swift
cluster at the same time.

After this patch, enqueue target of expiring tasks are automatically changed to
general task queue. Dequeue target of expiring tasks can be choosen by operator
from legacy (=the task queue used before this patch) or general task queue.

The general task queue system will be used in auto tiering task system too.

[1] Basic idea: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Swift/ideas/task-execution
[2] Details: https://docs.google.com/document/d/11sBbB6pBvLYNeM9wjTdvvsJIu8Dl8i13UH2NfRVNOqg/edit#

Co-Authored-By: Matthew Oliver <matt@oliver.net.au>

Change-Id: I4bb584dadc8d36e2533c5f7b555ce359fde79276

[{'created': '2021-05-20 11:31:37.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid unhandled exceptions during connecting to iSCSI portals

Currently we don't properly catch some possible exceptions during
connectiing to iSCSI portals, like failures in "iscsiadm -m session".
Because of this _connect_vol threads can abort unexpectedly in some
failure patterns, and this abort causes hung in subsequent steps

unexpected abort without updating thread results.

(cherry picked from commit 57c8f4334c0e58b151f449f3316bb9e1c8ed6da4)
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid unhandled exceptions during connecting to iSCSI portals

Currently we don't properly catch some possible exceptions during
connectiing to iSCSI portals, like failures in "iscsiadm -m session".
Because of this _connect_vol threads can abort unexpectedly in some
failure patterns, and this abort causes hung in subsequent steps
waiting for results from _connct_vol threads.

This change ensures that any exceptions during connecting to iSCSI
portals are handled in the _connect_vol method corectly, to avoid
unexpected abort without updating thread results.

Conflicts:
        os_brick/tests/initiator/connectors/test_iscsi.py

Closes-Bug: #1915678
Change-Id: I0278c502806b99f8ec65cb146e3852e43031e9b8
(cherry picked from commit 4478433550ddab970f106636a4ba5fbba82c5e39)
(cherry picked from commit 57c8f4334c0e58b151f449f3316bb9e1c8ed6da4)

[{'created': '2020-11-03 15:29:24.000000000', 'message': 'Do not fail when depth is greater than rbd_max_clone_depth

Removed a sanity check in the code that raised an exception
if the clone depth of a volume to be cloned exceeded the
rbd_max_clone_depth config value.  A consequence of this
check was that if an operator lowered the value, volumes
whose clone depth was greater than the new value (as would
be allowed by the previous, higher setting) could no longer
be cloned.

Change-Id: I8c445058a25c2eca2fda91bdeb6befedae34ccf2
Closes-bug: #1901241
(cherry picked from commit 8d8d242c3924037e6774a681efabce4893a26646)
(cherry picked from commit 23a821b2a4bbb5696bc27044a455fc7837641111)
(cherry picked from commit f6e5fe187ea947fd7d4624a4f456dd7e11c35c7d)
(cherry picked from commit 0a3345cc0589f93e09bf55e02502e14f6e58e70e)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not fail when depth is greater than rbd_max_clone_depth

Removed a sanity check in the code that raised an exception
if the clone depth of a volume to be cloned exceeded the
rbd_max_clone_depth config value.  A consequence of this
check was that if an operator lowered the value, volumes
whose clone depth was greater than the new value (as would
be allowed by the previous, higher setting) could no longer
be cloned.

Change-Id: I8c445058a25c2eca2fda91bdeb6befedae34ccf2
Closes-bug: #1901241
(cherry picked from commit 8d8d242c3924037e6774a681efabce4893a26646)
(cherry picked from commit 23a821b2a4bbb5696bc27044a455fc7837641111)
(cherry picked from commit f6e5fe187ea947fd7d4624a4f456dd7e11c35c7d)
(cherry picked from commit 0a3345cc0589f93e09bf55e02502e14f6e58e70e)

[{'created': '2021-05-28 12:46:21.000000000', 'message': "[CI] Support building source images with in-review changes

Following this change it is possible to add 'Depends-On' lines to a
kolla commit message that point to reviews in other projects. For
example, this could be used to test building and deploying container
images containing a change to the nova project that is currently in
review.

It also allows to introduce jobs testing against Kolla in other
projects.

The kolla-build-config Ansible role can also be used by other projects,
such as kolla-ansible, to generate the necessary configuration.

This takes us closer to the Kolla Builder - Next Generation concept [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014255.html

Change-Id: Ia2efa6b5d7278b75ab8dec23207f92d6bd7c58f0

commit_message:
[CI] Support building source images with in-review changes

Following this change it is possible to add 'Depends-On' lines to a
kolla commit message that point to reviews in other projects. For
example, this could be used to test building and deploying container
images containing a change to the nova project that is currently in
review.

It also allows to introduce jobs testing against Kolla in other
projects.

The kolla-build-config Ansible role can also be used by other projects,
such as kolla-ansible, to generate the necessary configuration.

This takes us closer to the Kolla Builder - Next Generation concept [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014255.html

Change-Id: Ia2efa6b5d7278b75ab8dec23207f92d6bd7c58f0
Co-Authored-By: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6bfe9b8749c9a41b3d37816879bb0fac1fdd60d5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-26 03:23:05.000000000', 'message': "NetApp SolidFire: Fix failback failing after service restart

After a successful failover, if the volume service was restarted,
the driver wouldn't be able to failback to the primary cluster
due to incomplete cluster data.

This patch address this problem by gathering data from the
primary cluster during the failback procedure.

Change-Id: I796fcf8969adae3338861a1b2f3310fafcacfbcb
Closes-bug: #1859653
(cherry picked from commit f24eb2fc630f32697fd9afdfdec97e0f61493a46)
(cherry picked from commit eec1b92171367545bc2de3217830e9354e6c6def)
"}]
commit_message:
NetApp SolidFire: Fix failback failing after service restart

After a successful failover, if the volume service was restarted,
the driver wouldn't be able to failback to the primary cluster
due to incomplete cluster data.

This patch address this problem by gathering data from the
primary cluster during the failback procedure.

Change-Id: I796fcf8969adae3338861a1b2f3310fafcacfbcb
Closes-bug: #1859653
(cherry picked from commit f24eb2fc630f32697fd9afdfdec97e0f61493a46)
(cherry picked from commit eec1b92171367545bc2de3217830e9354e6c6def)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-19 13:43:32.000000000', 'message': 'Add warning message about slow volume backend

If a volume driver takes an excessively long amount
of time to return volume stats info, the only indication
if this is a generic "Function outlasted interval" message
that doesn't really explain what is going on.

Introduce a specific log message when this happens so
that this situation is more clear for someone looking
at cinder-volume logs.

The message is set to trigger if the driver takes more
than half of the stats polling interval to complete.

Change-Id: Id6b27eb7b90c8a8c91fb46de69aa94b8210da18d
(cherry picked from commit 6d85d05f7847defcd972b1702ab9b14f22e60d4e)
'}]
commit_message:
Add warning message about slow volume backend

If a volume driver takes an excessively long amount
of time to return volume stats info, the only indication
if this is a generic "Function outlasted interval" message
that doesn't really explain what is going on.

Introduce a specific log message when this happens so
that this situation is more clear for someone looking
at cinder-volume logs.

The message is set to trigger if the driver takes more
than half of the stats polling interval to complete.

Change-Id: Id6b27eb7b90c8a8c91fb46de69aa94b8210da18d
(cherry picked from commit 6d85d05f7847defcd972b1702ab9b14f22e60d4e)

commit_message:
Use volume_type option in tempest.conf in compute api test

A new configuration option volume_type was added to tempest.conf
to allow tempest users to select volume type during volume creation.

In this patchset, this volume_type value is used if configured for
compute api volume creation.

Change-Id: I031094ab196268dc2c20b38be4864f59639358a7

commit_message:
Revert "Disable the osuosl arm64 cloud"

This reverts commit 841ed3f2eee567579080dd5de56ebfb9f83c0bb0.

This turned out to be due to timeouts of the service when starting.
We have increased this timeout with
I37186494b9afd72eab3a092279579f1a5fa5d22c.

Change-Id: Ied3abc965b39ff4d5cc7ee36b5c2173fd6f1e7b2

commit_message:
Move verify-ipv6-only-deployments

from Tempest to DevStack as it tests DevStack side of things and
is useful for projects not using Tempest.

This is part 2 of 2.
The 1st part is DevStack-side, in Depends-On.

The script is left calling out to devstack because legacy (dsvm)
jobs rely on its presence.

Depends-On: Ie166730843f874b9c99e37244e460d7ad33b7eeb

commit_message:
Remove references to directly editing files in /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates

If users directly edit the files from the RPM, the changes will be removed
on the next update. This can break the existing deployment if they don't
re-add the manual changes. Better to reference the available *OptVolume
parameters to achieve this.

Change-Id: Ic23fe1119191eea7d25b97b900e92764a5f7e751
Closes-Bug: #1847703

commit_message:
Remove the devstack/lib/ovs in favour of "ovs_source" from DevStack

This patch removes the devstack/lib/ovs module and update the scripts to
use the ovs_source module from DevStack instead.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/791085
Change-Id: I65fe53ee753ac68340f7d4d928643d3d8e5c8694
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

The Secure RBAC effort has updated Ironic such that it
can support a mode where it is scope enforcing for all
interactions with the API. Due to the design, and operating
nature of Ironic's API, services speaking with it must
authenticate with a system scope to have a full picture
of the universe.

accordingly such that the compute service understands
how to talk to ironic so that it can see the nodes under
management.

time to enable a "hybrid" mixed-mode as the operating model
and related permissions *should* allow nova to use a project
scoped "owner" account with Ironic, in order to access
and command nodes to deploy. But at this time, we're
focusing on the exclusive operating mode.
